keyMoments.title: Outlook III Recognizes His Son
keyMoments.description: Outlook III, a nobleman from High Town, recognizes and calls out to Sabo in public, but Sabo denies knowing him to protect his freedom.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Sabo's biological father, establishing the conflict between Sabo's noble birth and chosen life of freedom.

keyMoments.title: Outlook III Destroys Sabo's Drawing
keyMoments.description: In a flashback, young Sabo shows his father a drawing he made, but Outlook III angrily tears it apart and demands Sabo focus on his studies instead.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Outlook III's oppressive parenting and disregard for his son's individuality, showing why Sabo eventually ran away.
keyMoments.quote: Don't waste your time on such foolishness! Go study!

relationships.description: Outlook III is Sabo's biological father, but their relationship is strained due to Outlook's oppressive parenting and obsession with social status.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III recognizes Sabo in public, but Sabo denies knowing him, showing their broken relationship.

relationships.description: Outlook III is married to Didit, and they share the same oppressive parenting approach toward their son Sabo.

reveals.information: Prioritizes wealth and social status over his son's happiness and individuality

keyMoments.title: Didit Appears in Sabo's Flashback
keyMoments.description: Didit appears in flashbacks showing her role in pressuring young Sabo to conform to noble expectations and pursue an arranged marriage for social advancement.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Sabo's mother as complicit in his oppressive upbringing, showing the complete family environment that drove him to escape.

relationships.description: Didit is Sabo's biological mother who, along with her husband, pressured Sabo to conform to noble expectations.
Didit is married to Outlook III

keyMoments.title: Sabo Reveals Noble Heritage
keyMoments.description: Sabo confesses to Ace and Luffy that he is the son of nobleman Outlook III, explaining his troubled past and why he rejected his noble life.
keyMoments.significance: Major character development revealing Sabo's motivations and deepening his bond with Ace and Luffy who accept him regardless of his birth.
keyMoments.quote: I'm a noble. The son of Outlook III.

keyMoments.title: Brotherhood Sakazuki Ceremony
keyMoments.description: Sabo participates in the traditional sakazuki ceremony with Ace and Luffy, officially becoming sworn brothers through the exchange of sake cups.
keyMoments.significance: Cements the unbreakable bond between the three brothers that defines their characters throughout the series.

relationships.description: Sabo and Ace become sworn brothers through the sakazuki ceremony, forming an unbreakable bond.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo and Ace formalize their brotherhood through the sakazuki ceremony.

relationships.description: Sabo and Luffy become sworn brothers through the sakazuki ceremony, forming an unbreakable bond.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo and Luffy formalize their brotherhood through the sakazuki ceremony.

relationships.description: Outlook III is Sabo's biological father, but Sabo has rejected him and his noble life.
Didit is Sabo's biological mother, but Sabo has rejected her and his noble life.

reveals.information: Son of nobleman Outlook III and noblewoman Didit
Escaped from oppressive noble family to live freely in Grey Terminal
Officially becomes sworn brother to Ace and Luffy through sakazuki ceremony

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace Initiates Sakazuki Ceremony
keyMoments.description: Ace steals sake from Curly Dadan and brings three cups to perform the traditional sakazuki brotherhood ceremony with Sabo and Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Ace takes the lead in formalizing their brotherhood, showing his care for his bonds and understanding of traditional rituals.
keyMoments.quote: If men drink together, they become brothers!

keyMoments.title: Ace Vows to Become Famous
keyMoments.description: After the brotherhood ceremony, Ace declares he will become such a great pirate that everyone in the world will know his name.
keyMoments.significance: Tragically foreshadows Ace's fate - he does become world-famous, but through his death at Marineford rather than his pirate accomplishments.
keyMoments.quote: I'll become such a pirate that everyone will know my name!

relationships.description: Ace and Luffy formalize their brotherhood through the sakazuki ceremony.

evolutionMoments.description: The sakazuki ceremony officially makes Ace and Luffy sworn brothers.

relationships.description: Ace and Sabo become sworn brothers through the sakazuki ceremony.

evolutionMoments.description: The sakazuki ceremony officially makes Ace and Sabo sworn brothers.

reveals.information: Wants to become so famous as a pirate that everyone knows his name

keyMoments.title: Luffy Participates in Sakazuki Ceremony
keyMoments.description: Luffy participates in the traditional sakazuki ceremony with Ace and Sabo, officially becoming sworn brothers.
keyMoments.significance: Formalizes Luffy's brotherly bond with Ace and Sabo, a relationship that profoundly affects his character development.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Accidentally Reveals Rubber Powers
keyMoments.description: At a restaurant in High Town, Luffy uses his stretching rubber arms to grab food, accidentally revealing his Devil Fruit powers to shocked onlookers.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's carefree nature and inability to hide his powers, even when trying to maintain a low profile.

relationships.description: Luffy and Ace formalize their brotherhood through the sakazuki ceremony.

evolutionMoments.description: The sakazuki ceremony officially makes Luffy and Ace sworn brothers.

relationships.description: Luffy and Sabo become sworn brothers through the sakazuki ceremony.

evolutionMoments.description: The sakazuki ceremony officially makes Luffy and Sabo sworn brothers.

reveals.information: Officially becomes sworn brother to Ace and Sabo through sakazuki ceremony
